alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 4:47PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A thunderstorm with weak rotation and gusty winds will impact portions of northern Alamance and northern Orange Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Burlington, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Graham, Mebane, Gibsonville, Haw River, Lake Cammack Park & Marina, Carr, Glen Raven, Union Ridge and Lake Burlington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a warning may need to be issued. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central North Carolina.
